solution_line_template: I would currently be {my_age_multiplier}*{billy_current_age}=<<{my_age_multiplier}*{billy_current_age}={my_current_age}>>{my_current_age} years old, since I'm {my_age_multiplier} times older than Billy's age of {billy_current_age}.

Therefore, in order to find my age at Billy's birth we'd simply subtract Billy's age of {billy_current_age} from my age, meaning I was {my_current_age}-{billy_current_age}= <<{my_current_age}-{billy_current_age}={my_age_at_billys_birth}>>{my_age_at_billys_birth} years old
